result.execSummary:
The defendant Zechariah J. Bant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Discharge Firearm From/Across Highway. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail term is with huber privileges and is to commence within 7 days from 02-01-16.
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zechariah J. Bant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:32 am - Defendant Zechariah J. Bant appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA moves to amend Ct. 1 to 167.31(2)(d). DA certifies victims rights complaince. Court orders amendment of Ct. 1.  Defendant pleads GUILTY. Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty and orders JOC.  Court imposes: $200.50 forfeiture. Court questions defendant regarding right to attorney. Defendant pleads GUILTY to Ct. 2.    Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 2. Comments by DA. Comments by defendant. Court imposes: $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS and submit sample; 3 day jail term, with huber privileges, to commence within 7 days from 02-01-16. Payplan granted of $100/mo commencing 02-29-16 and each month thereafter until paid in full or CO. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:46 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Joshua Floyd.  DE may not possess firearms except for muzzleloading firearms.

Defendant Zechariah J. Bant appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. May not possess firearms except for muzzleloading firearms.  Amend bond with previous condition.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may not have contact with Joshua Floyd. Defendant may not possess a firearm.

Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Furh, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 12-1-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
